content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great simple Clash that can take a little extra time due to backslashes. Fun.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Plain simple and suitable for Clash of Code

Fastest and Reverse, also candidate for Shortest.
I pre-approve.

This puzzle will be very interesting for speed! I don't think a codegolf exercise would be interesting. On the other hand, the exercise lends itself very well to reverse. I'd like you to add this game mode before validating it.
I can only understand the problem by watching the examples. Anyone should be able to understand it without necessarily having to look at them...

Goal 
* Please format "[\*-*/]" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Please explain a bit more.

Output
* Please change " [ "\*"*n and "*/"*n ]" to "based on [[N]]".

Cases
* Except for the edge case of 0, other pairs of tests and validators should be different. Please change the value of [[N]] in Pairs 1, 2 and 4, so that in some pair(s), [[N]] in the test is greater than [[N]] in the validator, and in other pairs, the opposite is true. All [[N]] should be different in those 6 cases.

Thanks.

Goal
* Please change the second sentence as follows:

To create this figure you must repeat {{\*}} [[N]] times on the left and {{*/}} [[N]] times on the right, with a {{-}} character in the middle, and finally wrap everything with {{[}} and {{]}}.

Cases
* As mentioned in my last comment, please change the cases.

Thanks.
The statement has already been modified, now it is much clearer, thank you very much for the feedback.
Thank you very much for the recommendations, as for the cases they will be modified :D
Please change the input to Test 3 back to 0 as it is an edge case. Thanks.
